content.title: Mondor Disease
content.description: Superficial thrombophlebitis of the thoracoepigastric vein, typically presenting as a cord-like structure on the lateral chest wall.

clinical_features.presentation: Painful cord-like structure from breast area toward axilla or abdomen

diagnosis.clinical: Palpable cord along thoracoepigastric vein distribution

treatment.workup: Consider mammography if suspicious for underlying malignancy

content.clinical_pearl: Benign and self-limited, but always exclude underlying breast pathology
